input: user: I require assistance in drafting a Shakespearean style farewell speech to bid adieu to a beloved colleague.
coverage:
Ah, noble colleague, 'tis with heavy heart,  
That we dost gather now to bid thee part.  
As gentle days do fade to soft farewell,  
We find ourselves ensnared in sorrow's spell.  

Thy presence, like the sunlit morn's embrace,  
Hath warmed our spirits, graced our humble place.  
In merry times thou sharedst laughter's tune,  
And when the tempest roared, a steadfast boon.

As ships dost sail to seas afar and wide,  
So must thou journey hence with honour's stride.  
Yet though thou leavest, etched in memory's tome,  
Thy spirit shall within these halls find home.

Hark, let us raise a cup in thy renown,  
For as our paths diverge, our hearts we crown.  
In every challenge met and conquered o'er,  
Thy valor, wisdom, gifts we shall adore.

Go forth, dear friend, to realms yet unexplored,  
Armed with the love and blessings from this board.  
And when upon some distant shore thou'rt found,  
Remember us, in friendship ever bound.

With this, we lay our tribute at thy feet,  
A heartfelt ode, in prose and verse complete.  
Farewell, dear soul, till fates permit once more,  
Our roads converge upon a kinder shore.
